metadata.Name: POLYGLOT-NER
metadata.Description: A multilingual Named Entity Recognition system for 40 languages built using Wikipedia and Freebase, requiring no language-specific resources or expertise
metadata.Paper Title: POLYGLOT-NER: Massive Multilingual Named Entity Recognition
Affiliations: Department of Computer Science Stony Brook University
metadata.Abstract: The increasing diversity of languages used on the web introduces a new level of complexity to Information Retrieval (IR) systems. We can no longer assume that textual content is written in one language or even the same language family. In this paper, we demonstrate how to build massive multilingual annotators with minimal human expertise and intervention. We describe a system that builds Named Entity Recognition (NER) annotators for 40 major languages using Wikipedia and Freebase. Our approach does not require NER human annotated datasets or language specific resources like treebanks, parallel corpora, and orthographic rules. The novelty of approach lies therein - using only language agnostic techniques, while achieving competitive performance.
